alert.note: Alert for Cook; De Kalb; Kendall; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 4:24AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Illinois and northeast Illinois, including the following areas, in north central Illinois, De Kalb. In northeast Illinois, Cook, Kendall and Will. * WHEN...Until 730 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 423 AM CDT, doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Aurora, Joliet, Naperville, Bolingbrook, Orland Park, Tinley Park, DeKalb, Romeoville, Plainfield, Woodridge, Oswego, Chicago Heights, Oak Forest, Lockport, New Lenox, Homer Glen, Park Forest, Homewood, Matteson and Mokena. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
